qas.question: What type of authority are ambulatory care pharmacists given in the U.S. federal health care system?
In what states are pharmacist clinicians given prescriptive and diagnostic authority?
When was ambulatory care pharmacy approved as its own certification?
What will a pharmacist who passes the ambulatory pharmacist exam be called?
What entities are included in the federal health care system?

answers.text: the VA, the Indian Health Service, and NIH
the VA, the Indian Health Service, and NIH
VA, the Indian Health Service, and NIH

qas.question: What type of authority are ambulatory care pharmacists not given in the U.S. federal health care system?
What states are pharmacist clinicians given no prescriptive and diagnostic authority?
When was ambulatory care pharmacy rejected as its own certification?

plausible_answers.text: the VA, the Indian Health Service, and NIH

qas.question: What entities are not included in the federal health care system?
What will a pharmacist who fails the ambulatory pharmacist exam be called?

context: In the U.S. federal health care system (including <a4_0><a4_1><b8_0>the <a4_2>VA, the Indian Health Service, and NIH<b8_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>) ambulatory care pharmacists are given <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>full independent prescribing authority<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>. In some states such <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>North Carolina and New Mexico<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> these pharmacist clinicians are given collaborative prescriptive and diagnostic authority. In <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>2011<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> the board of Pharmaceutical Specialties approved ambulatory care pharmacy practice as a separate board certification. The official designation for pharmacists who pass the ambulatory care pharmacy specialty certification exam will be <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b9_0>Board Certified Ambulatory Care Pharmacist<b9_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> and these pharmacists will carry the initials BCACP.
